intro: Betonica macrostachys, commonly known as the large-stalked betony, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowering stems can reach up to 1 meter in height. Betonica macrostachys is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine.
